title: Honoring 11-year-old J.P. Iacona of Elmont, New York, for his ceaseless dedicated service to his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring 11-year-old J.P. Iacona of Elmont, New
York, for his ceaseless dedicated service to the Elmont community

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to act, in accord with
its long-standing traditions, honoring the achievements of its promising
citizens and leaders of tomorrow, whose character and achievements  best
exemplify  the  ideals  and  values  cherished  by  this great State and
Nation; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud  to  honor  11-year-old
J.P.  Iacona of Elmont, New York, for his ceaseless dedicated service to
his community; and
  WHEREAS, Eager in his initiatives and poised in his  approaches,  J.P.
Iacona  has  given  of his time and energy, tirelessly raising funds for
America's VetDogs; and
  WHEREAS, For the last 64 years, America's VetDogs have provided  guide
dogs,  service  dogs and new technologies for disabled veterans; men and
women who have lost their eyesight or limbs,  suffered  traumatic  brain
injuries  or post-traumatic stress disorder are given companions to help
them lead a more active life; and
  WHEREAS, In addition to raising money for  VetDogs,  J.P  Iacona  also
involves  himself  in other charitable endeavors; he has been collecting
scrap metal for charity and started a recycling program at Covert Avenue
School in Elmont; and
  WHEREAS, J.P Iacona has made a significant difference in his  communi-
ty; his contributions have served as a valuable resource for the people,
veterans,  active  soldiers  and returning soldiers of Elmont, New York;
and
  WHEREAS, With his sense of civic duty and his  commitment  to  others,
J.P.    Iacona  represents  the  potential inherent in our most precious
resource, our youth; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this  Legislative  Body  that  when  young
people  of such noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor 11-year-old J.P. Iacona of Elmont, New  York,  for  his  ceaseless
dedicated service to the Elmont community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to J.P. Iacona, Elmont, New York.
